metadata.dc:title: Palliative care in the elderly: principles for an adequate medical care
metadata.dc:description: Palliative care provides an adequate health carefor the elderly at the end of life. Predictors ofend-stage disease identify a population of patientswho would benefit from a palliative orientedcare. The management of palliative oriented healthcare should include an adequate patient evaluation,care plan, team work, coordination of healthcare assistance levels and improving qualitymanagement
